repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: XDG_* environment variables with doubled values source twice.

Solution: remove duplicate values in XDG_CONFIG_DIR or XDG_DATA_DIR.


Fix #5462
Close #12600

comment_data.body: I don't think the `xstrdup()` is necessary. I think the existing token will still remain valid even as `os_strtok()` returns the next.
seems like before auto import forget to remove.

This was only present in `runtime.c` because it is used in a function prototype. In `stdpaths.c` it can just be `kvec_t(char *)` as it's a local variable, and the `CharVec` name is not very straightforward.
aha okay.  is it not useful in somewhere else for future usage? or can make a more sense name.
In any case `runtime.h` is not a suitable place for such a type, because it has nothing to do with "runtime".
I think we can use `ENV_SEPSTR` here which will be either `:` or `;` already.
I don't think this is correct. It should use `path_fnamecmp()`.
on Windows should we support both "/" and "\\" ?

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -378,7 +378,7 @@ describe('XDG defaults', function()
             .. root_path
             .. ('/b'):rep(2048)
             .. '/nvim'
-            .. (',' .. root_path .. '/c/nvim'):rep(512)
+            .. (',' .. root_path .. '/c/nvim')

comment_data.body: How is that related to this line?
My mistake, I was thinking about PATHSEP when I saw the `sep` parameter.

comment_regular_data.body:
Looks like false positive? It thinks that xstrdup doesn't return a null terminated string
```
      4. string_null_source: Function xstrdup does not terminate its return value.[hide details]
      5. var_assign: Assigning: ret = xstrdup(env_val).
164    ret = xstrdup(env_val);
```

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(stdpath): remove duplicate directories
